issue.title: New --links parameter not working with mount?

milestone.title: Soon
milestone.description: Issues which are a good idea but haven't been assigned a specific release yet.

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
#### What is the problem you are having with rclone?

I uploaded some symlinks with "rclone copy" and parameter "--links" to my gdrive remote.
As expected, files with the extension "rclonelink" are generated.

I now expect that the rclonelink files are not visible via rclone mount. Instead they should be translated to symlinks. But actually it is not the case. Only plain rclonelink files are visible.

Additionally I'm also not able to create symlink. Instead I get I/O error (see below).


#### What is your rclone version (output from `rclone version`)
rclone v1.46-DEV (latest commit as of today)


#### Which OS you are using and how many bits (eg Windows 7, 64 bit)
Linux x64


####  Which cloud storage system are you using? (eg Google Drive)
Google Drive


#### The command you were trying to run (eg `rclone copy /tmp remote:tmp`)
rclone --config /config/rclone.conf mount gdrive_decrypted:/ /mnt --allow-other --allow-non-empty --uid=1000 --gid=1000 --umask=007 --links --fast-list --rc--verbose


#### A log from the command with the `-vv` flag (eg output from `rclone -vv copy /tmp remote:tmp`)
ln -s /tmp/testfile testlink
ln: testlink: I/O error

rename.from: --links flag does not seem to work with rclone mount crypt
rename.to: --links flag does not seem to work with rclone mount crypt; local to local

body:
I can replicate this.

Removing the `--vfs-cache-mode writes` makes it work.

The file is written to the VFS cache just fine. However the writeback does not work.  It says it does

```
2025/02/10 12:54:52 DEBUG : test_symlink3.rclonelink: vfs cache: starting upload
2025/02/10 12:54:52 INFO  : test_symlink3.rclonelink: vfs cache: upload succeeded try #1 
```

But nothing is uploaded!

However if I try uploading a file it works fine and you get a bit more in the log

```
2025/02/10 12:56:24 DEBUG : file2.txt: vfs cache: starting upload
2025/02/10 12:56:24 DEBUG : file2.txt.18668773.partial: md5 = 1021a39b359f5aaa476ff6b1abd68a39 OK
2025/02/10 12:56:24 DEBUG : file2.txt.18668773.partial: renamed to: file2.txt
2025/02/10 12:56:24 INFO  : file2.txt: Copied (new)
2025/02/10 12:56:24 DEBUG : file2.txt: vfs cache: fingerprint now "6,2025-02-10 12:56:19.805346274 +0000 UTC"
2025/02/10 12:56:24 DEBUG : file2.txt: vfs cache: writeback object to VFS layer
2025/02/10 12:56:24 DEBUG : : Added virtual directory entry vAddFile: "file2.txt"
2025/02/10 12:56:24 INFO  : file2.txt: vfs cache: upload succeeded try #1
```

Will investigate further...

I've managed to track this down - it is the global `--links` flag affecting the internal local backends the VFS uses.

I've fixed that - please give this a try

[v1.70.0-beta.8576.44668e731.fix-8367-vfs-links](https://beta.rclone.org/branch/fix-8367-vfs-links/v1.70.0-beta.8576.44668e731.fix-8367-vfs-links/) on branch [fix-8367-vfs-links](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/tree/fix-8367-vfs-links) (uploaded in 15-30 mins)

Thank you for testing.

I've merged this to master now which means it will be in [the latest beta](https://beta.rclone.org/) in 15-30 minutes and released in v1.70 and v1.69.1
